text: Ethel Katherine Crum (1886-1943) was an American botanist, noted for collecting and studying California flora, as well as serving as assistant curator of the University of California Herbarium. She discovered and formally described at least 13 species and varieties of plants. == References == Category:1886 births Category:1943 deaths Category:American women scientists Category:American botanists Category:American curators
title: Ethel Katherine Crum
